intro: Bupleurum spinosum, commonly known as spiny bugloss, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered with small, spiny structures. The plant produces blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bupleurum spinosum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
